description: Unique identifier for this data dictionary record describing a specific table column in the application.
Name of the database catalog that contains the referenced table.
Logical schema owning the referenced table.
Name of the table the metadata row describes.
Name of the column being described.
Position of the column within the table’s column order.
Default value applied by the database when no value is provided.
Indicates whether the column can store null (blank) values.
Database data type assigned to the column.
Maximum allowed length for character-based columns; not applicable for non-character types.
User-facing caption for the field used in forms, lists, or reports.
Optional keyboard shortcut associated with the field in the user interface; likely legacy.
Suggested input control width/size for the field on forms; UI hint.
Controls whether the field is shown in default templates or grid views.
Display sequence for the field within a template or grid.
Text alignment for the field when displayed (e.g., left, center, right).
Business rule flag indicating the field must be populated to save records.
Identifies whether the field’s values come from a reference/lookup list.
Name of the reference table or list supplying valid values.
Foreign key or join key used to link the field to its lookup source.
Client-side script to execute when the field’s value changes; confirm usage with SME.
Client-side script triggered on keypress within the field; confirm usage with SME.
Client-side script executed when the field gains focus; confirm usage with SME.
Client-side script executed when the field loses focus; confirm usage with SME.
Default used by an MC-specific client or context; likely product-specific; confirm with SME.
Flag to trigger a popup when applying a value in an MC-specific client; likely product-specific; confirm with SME.
Identifies whether this field is custom-configured (not part of the standard model).
Indicates whether changes to this field are tracked in the audit log.
Marks this field as part of the entity’s audit display name for change history.
For date fields, specifies whether time component should also be stored/used.
Prevents the field from being selected/filtered in report builders; used to simplify choices.
Caption for the field when displayed in reports.
If enabled, reporting will total/aggregate this field when included.
Timestamp of the last update to this dictionary row for versioning.
Indicates whether the field is editable in forms or only viewable; confirm with SME.
Reference to an illustrative screenshot for documentation or training; slot 1.
Reference to an illustrative screenshot for documentation or training; slot 2.
Reference to an illustrative screenshot for documentation or training; slot 3.
Code controlling editability or formatting in report contexts; meaning may be system-specific; confirm with SME.
Destination module to copy this value to after successful validation; supports cross-module synchronization.
Destination field to receive the copied value upon validation.
Hides the field on configured forms.
Marks the field as required on specific forms (UI-level rule).
Additional form caption text or alternate label (slot 1); may support multi-line or localization.
Additional form caption text or alternate label (slot 2); may support multi-line or localization.
Additional form caption text or alternate label (slot 3); may support multi-line or localization.
Additional form caption text or alternate label (slot 4); may support multi-line or localization.
Additional form caption text or alternate label (slot 5); may support multi-line or localization.
Additional form caption text or alternate label (slot 6); may support multi-line or localization.
Additional form caption text or alternate label (slot 7); may support multi-line or localization.
Additional form caption text or alternate label (slot 8); may support multi-line or localization.
Additional form caption text or alternate label (slot 9); may support multi-line or localization.
Additional form caption text or alternate label (slot 10); may support multi-line or localization.
Internal control identifier used to bind the form input to the data field.
Flag controlling client-side validation for the form control.
Indicates whether this field can be modified via batch/mass update operations.
Secondary hide flag for alternate forms or conditional states; confirm with SME.
